article: I didn't cry when I learned I was the parent of a mentally handicapped child. "Go ahead and cry,"the doctor  _  kindly. But I couldn't cry then nor during the months that followed. We sent her to a kindergarten in our neighborhood at age seven. I worried that she was the "  _  " child among twenty fiveyearolds.  _  ,positive things began to happen to Kristi in her school,and to her schoolmates,too. When talking big of their own accomplishments,Kristi's classmates always took  _  to praise her as well,"Kristi got all her spelling words right today."No one would say that her spelling list was easier than anyone else's. During Kristi's second year in school,she  _  a very special challenge. The big public event of the term was a  _  based on the final outcome of the year's music and physical education activities. Kristi was  _  in both. My husband and I felt  _  about the day as well. On the day of the program,Kristi  _  to be sick. Desperately I wanted to keep her home. Why let Kristi fail in a gymnasium  _  with parents,students and teachers?What a simple  _  !But I finally got her onto the school bus. Just as I had forced my daughter to go to school,now I forced myself to go,too. Then I knew Kristi's  _  .Her class was divided into relay teams. With her slow and clumsy reactions,she would surely  hold up  her team. But as Kristi's turn to  _  neared,a change took place in her team. The tallest boy in the line stepped  _  Kristi and placed his hands on her waist. Two other boys stood a little ahead of her. The  _  the player in front of Kristi stepped from the sack(bag),the two boys seized it and held it open while the tall boy  _  Kristi and dropped her neatly into the sack. A girl ahead took her hand and supported her until she gained her  _  .Then off Kristi hopped ,smiling and proud. At the cheers of the crowd,I slipped out to thank Heaven for the warm and considerate people making it possible for my  _  daughter to be like her fellow human beings. Then I finally  _  .
